Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Anita Burson, Elpida Community Church of Christ Baptist, 121 New York Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11216.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Anita Burson, Elpida Community Church of Christ Baptist, 121 New York Avenue, Broklyn, N.Y. 11216.



Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting his determination that coterminality of the 77th, 78th, and 88th police precincts with the corresponding community districts in Brooklyn would be inconsistent with the most effective delivery of police services, pursuant to Section 2704(b) of the City Charter.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting his determination that coterminality of the 77th, 78th, and 88th police precincts with the corresponding community districts in Brooklyn would be inconsistent with the most effective delivery of police services.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Transmitting proposed amendment to a maritime lease between the New York City Department of Small Business Services  and Sea Travelers Realty Inc. d/b/a Sea Travelers Marina for certain city owned upland area and lands under water located in the Mill Basin area of Brooklyn, pursuant to Section 1301(2)(f) of the City Charter.
Items.AgendaNote: Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Siting and Maritime Uses
Items.MatterName: Transmitting proposed amendment to a maritime lease between the NYC Department of Small Business Services and Sea Travelers Realty Inc. d/b/a Sea Travelers Marina.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Department of Environmental Protection - Submitting the Mayor’s approval of the conveyance of the Mt. Hayden Property by donation from the New York City Department of Environmental Protection to the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation, Town of Windham, Greene County, pursuant to Section 72-h of the General Municipal Law.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Planning, Dispositions and Concessions
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Mayor’s approval of the conveyance of the Mt. Hayden Property by donation from the NYC Dept of Environmental Protection to the NYS Dept of Environmental Conservation, Town of Windham, Greene County.

Items.Title: Communication from the Taxi & Limousine Commission – Submitting its approval of an application for a relocation base station FLAMINGO TRANSPORTATION & LIMO. SERVICE INC., Council District 35, pursuant to Section 19-511(i), of the administrative code of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Base Station License, FLAMINGO TRANSPORTATION & LIMO. SERVICE INC.

Items.Title: Communication from the Taxi & Limousine Commission – Submitting its approval of an application for a relocation base station license WASHINGTON RADIO DISPATCH INC., Council District 10, pursuant to Section 19-511(i), of the administrative code of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Base Station License, WASHINGTON RADIO DISPATCH INC.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to opportunities for minority and women owned business enterprises and emerging business enterprises in city procurement.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Opportunities for minority and women owned business enterprises and emerging business enterprises in city procurement.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record or criminal conviction and repealing subdivision 11 of section 8-107 of chapter one of title eight of the administrative code of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting discrimination based on one’s arrest record or criminal conviction.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to community boards.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Community Boards

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to reverse its order of contempt on United States Attorney General Eric Holder.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Congress to reverse its order of contempt on US Attorney General Eric Holder.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to signage at bus stops.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Signage at bus stops.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to individuals with outstanding charges owed to the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Individuals with outstanding charges owed to the city of New York.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the anti-graffiti task force.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Anti-graffiti task force.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon New York State to amend the form that applicants complete to apply for public assistance and to require the sponsor of an immigrant to co-sign the application in order for the immigrant to apply for public assistance.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Amend the form that applicants complete to apply for public assistance and to require the sponsor of an immigrant to co-sign the application in order for the immigrant to apply for public assistance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to curb cuts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Curb cuts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to trap-neuter-return information and activities in the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Trap-neuter-return information and activities in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the location of muni-meters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Location of muni-meters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bus and subway fare evasion reporting.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Bus and subway fare evasion reporting.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exempting zero emission vehicles from idling restrictions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Exempting zero emission vehicles from idling restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting electrical meters to be installed for electric vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Permitting electrical meters to be installed for electric vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Federal Communications Commission to conduct a review of wireless device radiation standards.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: US Federal Communications Commission to conduct a review of wireless device radiation standards.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing the taxi and limousine commission to replace hybrid electric vehicles with electric vehicles or any other vehicle model which has fewer emissions than electric vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Allowing TLC  to replace hybrid electric vehicles with electric vehicles or any other vehicle model which has fewer emissions than electric vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would establish a public campaign financing system for campaigns for the office of New York State Comptroller.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establish a public campaign financing system for campaigns for the office of NYS Comptroller.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Police Department and the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to stop arresting people for committing minor infractions in the transit system, irrespective of whether they have an arrest record or have previously committed minor infractions in the system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD and the MTA to stop arresting people for committing minor infractions in the transit system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation supporting breakfast in the classroom in every school in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  
Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Oddo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Supporting breakfast in the classroom in every school in New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to support breakfast in the classroom in every school in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) called for a voice vote.  
Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 2 Council Members formally voted against this item: Council Members Oddo and Ignizio.



Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to support breakfast in the classroom in every school in NYC.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)
The presence of a quorum was announced by The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera).
The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

At this point, the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.

This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by a vote of the Council pursuant to 197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Wolfe's Pond Park north of Hylan Blvd & west of Luten Ave; the establishment of Cornelia Ave north of Hylan Blvd; the extinguishment of various record streets between Hylan Blvd and Eylandt St. west of Luten Ave (C 060494 MMR)
